review: So far, so good with Fire TV sticks throughout the house.  The only issue has been that they need an "update" out of the box before they work, and you need to be very close for the router for some reason for it to work.  Once updated, everything works great.  I own a couple Roku's and WD TV Live devices, and this certainly seems to be the best all around device as it offers all of the common apps that are lacking with other devices.  We use Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, and Hulu, and everything loads extremely fast and looks great.  I was able to get 2 of these for $20 each with the Prime member offer, but it is certainly worth the $40 price if you have a TV with an HDMI port and decent wifi.  Be aware that these sticks do require an external power supply which is included in the box.  The remote is simple and easy to use, and young kids have no trouble navigating with it.  I'd recommend this to anyone looking for an alternative to expensive cable or satellite packages!
